page.title: 01Review of Staverton
page.content: If you stand on the summit of any one of the small hills in this block the rich growth of trees shows you the course of the River Dart.The great dark patch of conifers to the south hides an iron age fort and there are quite a few scattered mature trees. The 100 foot high pylons carry National Grid cables from the electricity substation and straddle the landscape and intrude upon the view from every high place . The picturesque bridge over the Dart and the nearby Dart Valley Railway Station make it a popular place for visitors and film directors. Farming is the major occupation here, dairying, animal husbandry,and cereal growing.Large areas are used for hay and silage production.
